00048 /**************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File: post_increment.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description:
00053  *     Convert ld and add or st and add pairs into a postincrement instruction.
00054  *
00055  *  Authors: Bob McGowan
00056  *
00057  *
00058 \************************************************************************/
00059 /* 09/17/02 REK Updating to use the new tahoeops and completers scheme. */
00060 
00061 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00062 #include <config.h>
00063 #include "mia_internal.h"
00064 #include <Lcode/l_softpipe.h>
00065 
00066 /* #define DEBUG_POST_INC */
00067 
00068 /* #define DEBUG */
00069 
00070 static void Mia_cb_post_increment (L_Cb * cb, int conservative,
00071                                    int ld, int st);
00072 
00073 /****************************************************************************
00074  *
00075  * routine: Convert_to_post_increment_ops()
00076  * purpose: This is the top level call to the post increment optimization.
00077  *          Only easily recognizable post increments are done.  A ld/st is
00078  *          matched with an add which is either in the same basic block or
00079  *          atleast in the same cb.  If the add move above a branch the
00080  *          address register cannot be live out the taken path of the branch.
00081  *          No attempt is made to merge multiple adds.
00082  * input: fn - function to process.
00083  * output:
00084  * returns:
00085  * modified: 1/10/97 - Bob McGowan - created
00086  * note:
00087  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00088 
00089 void
00090 Mia_post_increment_conversion (L_Func * fn, int ld, int st)
00091 {
00092   L_Cb *cb;
00093 
00094   for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb; cb = cb->next_cb)
00095     if (!L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_SOFTPIPE))
00096       Mia_cb_post_increment (cb, 0, ld, st);
00097 
00098   return;
00099 }
00100 
00101 /****************************************************************************
00102  *
00103  * routine: Conservative_post_increment_conversion()
00104  * purpose: This is the top level call to the conservative post increment 
00105  *          optimization.  This optimization is run at the end of phase 1
00106  *          and is designed to make post increment optimization available 
00107  *          for modulo scheduled loops and for more accurate scheduling without
00108  *          inhibiting scheduling opportunities for loads and stores.
00109  * input: fn - function to process.
00110  * output:
00111  * returns:
00112  * modified: 9/6/97 - Dan Lavery - created
00113  * note:
00114  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00115 
00116 void
00117 Mia_softpipe_post_increment_conversion (L_Func * fn, int ld, int st)
00118 {
00119   L_Cb *cb;
00120 
00121   for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb; cb = cb->next_cb)
00122     if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_SOFTPIPE))
00123       Mia_cb_post_increment (cb, 1, ld, st);
00124 
00125   return;
00126 }
00127 
00128 /****************************************************************************
00129  *
00130  * routine: Convert_mem_op_to_post_inc()
00131  * purpose: Convert the given memory operation into a post increment version.
00132  *          Use the operand for the post-inc value or register.
00133  * input: mem_oper - either a load or store
00134  *        inc_opernad - the register or constant to use as the increment.
00135  * output:
00136  * returns:
00137  * modified: 1/10/97 - Bob McGowan - created
00138  * note: A copy of the inc_operand is NOT made.  The memory oper will own
00139  *       the given operand after this routine.
00140  *       The address operand is copied to the destination operands.
00141  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00142 
00143 static void
00144 Convert_mem_op_to_post_inc (L_Oper * mem_oper, L_Operand * inc_operand)
00145 {
00146   switch (mem_oper->proc_opc)
00147     {
00148     case TAHOEop_LD1:
00149       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_C);
00150       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00151       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD1_POST; */
00152       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD1;
00153       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00154       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00155       break;
00156 
00157     case TAHOEop_LD2:
00158       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_C2);
00159       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00160       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD2_POST; */
00161       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD2;
00162       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00163       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00164       break;
00165 
00166     case TAHOEop_LD4:
00167       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_I);
00168       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00169       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD4_POST; */
00170       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD4;
00171       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00172       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00173       break;
00174 
00175     case TAHOEop_LD8:
00176       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_Q);
00177       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00178       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD8_POST; */
00179       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD8;
00180       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00181       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00182       break;
00183 
00184     case TAHOEop_LD8_FILL:
00185       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_Q);
00186       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00187       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD8_FILL_POST; */
00188       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LD8_FILL;
00189       mem_oper->opcode = L_opcode_name (mem_oper->opc);
00190       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00191       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00192       break;
00193 
00194     case TAHOEop_LDFS:
00195       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_F);
00196       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00197       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDF_S_POST; */
00198       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDFS;
00199       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00200       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00201       break;
00202 
00203     case TAHOEop_LDFD:
00204       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_F2);
00205       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00206       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDF_D_POST; */
00207       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDFD;
00208       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00209       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00210       break;
00211 
00212     case TAHOEop_LDF_FILL:
00213       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_LD_POST_F2);
00214       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00215       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDF_FILL_POST; */
00216       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_LDF_FILL;
00217       mem_oper->src[1] = inc_operand;
00218       mem_oper->dest[1] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00219       break;
00220 
00221     case TAHOEop_ST1:
00222       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_C);
00223       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00224       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST1_POST; */
00225       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST1;
00226       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00227       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00228       break;
00229 
00230     case TAHOEop_ST2:
00231       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_C2);
00232       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00233       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST2_POST; */
00234       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST2;
00235       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00236       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00237       break;
00238 
00239     case TAHOEop_ST4:
00240       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_I);
00241       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00242       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST4_POST; */
00243       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST4;
00244       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00245       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00246       break;
00247 
00248     case TAHOEop_ST8:
00249       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_Q);
00250       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00251       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST8_POST; */
00252       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST8;
00253       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00254       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00255       break;
00256 
00257     case TAHOEop_ST8_SPILL:
00258       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_I);
00259       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00260       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST8_SPILL_POST; */
00261       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_ST8_SPILL;
00262       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00263       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00264       break;
00265 
00266     case TAHOEop_STFS:
00267       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_F);
00268       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00269       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STF_S_POST; */
00270       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STFS;
00271       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00272       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00273       break;
00274 
00275     case TAHOEop_STFD:
00276       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_F2);
00277       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00278       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STF_D_POST; */
00279       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STFD;
00280       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00281       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00282       break;
00283 
00284     case TAHOEop_STF_SPILL:
00285       L_change_opcode (mem_oper, Lop_ST_POST_F2);
00286       /* L_change_opcode clobbers proc_opc, so it needs to be reset. */
00287       /* mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STF_SPILL_POST; */
00288       mem_oper->proc_opc = TAHOEop_STF_SPILL;
00289       mem_oper->src[2] = inc_operand;
00290       mem_oper->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (mem_oper->src[0]);
00291       break;
00292 
00293     default:
00294       L_punt ("M_convert_mem_oper_to_post_incr: Unknown tahoeop "
00295               "oper:%d  tahoeop:%d\n", mem_oper->id, mem_oper->proc_opc);
00296     }                           /* switch */
00297 }                               /* Convert_mem_op_to_post_inc */
00298 
00299 
00300 /****************************************************************************
00301   routine: L_live_out_inhibits_scheduling()
00302   purpose: Return 0 if the given operand is not live out
00303            anywhere in the given cb, with some exceptions.  The operand may
00304            be live out of the target of a branch that has the given cb as its
00305            destination as long as that branch is not above the given add oper.
00306 
00307   input: cb - block to process.
00308          operand - operand being checked
00309          add - a branch to the given cb must not be above this oper
00310   output:
00311   returns: 0 if not live out as described above.  1 otherwise.
00312   modified: 9/6/97 - Dan Lavery - created
00313   note:
00314  ***************************************************************************/
00315 
00316 
00317 static int
00318 L_live_out_inhibits_scheduling (L_Cb * cb, L_Operand * operand, L_Oper * add)
00319 {
00320   L_Oper *oper;
00321   L_Oper *last;
00322   L_Cb *target;
00323   int past_add = 0;
00324 
00325   for (oper = cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00326     {
00327       if (oper == add)
00328         past_add = 1;
00329 
00330       if (L_general_branch_opcode (oper))
00331         {
00332           target = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
00333           if (((target != cb) || !past_add) &&
00334               L_in_oper_OUT_set (cb, oper, operand, TAKEN_PATH))
00335             return 1;
00336         }
00337     }
00338 
00339   last = cb->last_op;
00340 
00341   if (!L_general_branch_opcode (last) ||
00342       L_cond_branch_opcode (last) ||
00343       (L_uncond_branch_opcode (last) && L_is_predicated (last) &&
00344        !L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK_NO_FALLTHRU)))
00345     {
00346       if (cb->next_cb && L_in_cb_IN_set (cb->next_cb, operand))
00347         return 1;
00348     }
00349 
00350   return 0;
00351 }
00352 
00353 /****************************************************************************
00354  *
00355  * routine: Mia_cb_post_increment ()
00356  * purpose: Finds ld/add or st/add pairs and convert them into a post increment
00357  *          memory instruction.  This is a very limited routine.  It only
00358  *          operates on pairs that are within the same basic block.
00359  *          This is run before scheduling, and we don't want to inhibit
00360  *          scheduling of the memory instructions.  Therefore the address
00361  *          must not be live out of any exit from the cb.  Modulo scheduling
00362  *          cannot rename the address register in a post increment load or
00363  *          store.  Therefore there memory instruction must be only one use of 
00364  *          the address. 
00365  *
00366  * input: cb - block to process.
00367  * output:
00368  * returns:
00369  * modified: 9/6/97 - Dan Lavery - created from Bob's Simple_post_increment
00370  * note: Looks for the pattern:
00371  *          (p) ld|st   rW = [rX]
00372  *          (p) add     rX = rY|C,rX
00373  *       and replaces it with
00374  *          (p) ld|st   rW = [rX],rY|C
00375  *       rY|C means either a register or a constant.
00376  *       The predicates must be the same.
00377  *       Do not run copy propagation after post-increment conversion. ????
00378  *       Data flow analysis needs to be run before this to tell the live out
00379  *       registers on each branch.
00380  *
00381  * 08/28/03 REK The increment operand for a store must be an IMM9 constant.
00382  *              Only loads can use a register.
00383  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00384 
00385 static void
00386 Mia_cb_post_increment (L_Cb * cb, int conservative, int ld, int st)
00387 {
00388   L_Oper *opA;
00389   L_Oper *opB;
00390   L_Operand *address;
00391 
00392   for (opA = cb->first_op; opA; opA = opA->next_op)
00393     {
00394       if (!(ld && L_general_load_opcode (opA)) &&
00395           !(st && L_store_opcode (opA)))
00396         continue;
00397 
00398       address = opA->src[0];
00399 
00400 #ifdef DEBUG
00401       fprintf (stderr, "cb %d, ld/st op %d, address in ", cb->id, opA->id);
00402       L_print_operand (stderr, address, 0);
00403       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00404 #endif
00405 
00406       for (opB = opA->next_op; opB; opB = opB->next_op)
00407         {
00408           if (L_general_branch_opcode (opB) &&
00409               L_in_oper_OUT_set (cb, opB, address, TAKEN_PATH))
00410             break;
00411 
00412           if (!L_int_add_opcode (opB) ||
00413               !L_same_operand (address, opB->dest[0]))
00414             continue;
00415 
00416 #ifdef DEBUG
00417           fprintf (stderr, "  add with matching dest reg\n");
00418           if (L_same_operand (address, opB->src[1]) &&
00419               L_same_operand (opA->pred[0], opB->pred[1]))
00420             {
00421               fprintf (stderr, "  add x = ?,x\n");
00422               if (L_no_defs_between (address, opA, opB))
00423                 fprintf (stderr, "  No address defs between\n");
00424               if (L_no_uses_between (address, opA, opB))
00425                 fprintf (stderr, "  No address uses between\n");
00426             }
00427 #endif
00428 
00429           if (!L_same_operand (address, opB->src[1]) ||
00430               !PG_equivalent_predicates_ops (opA, opB) ||
00431               !L_no_defs_between (address, opA, opB) ||
00432               !L_no_uses_between (address, opA, opB))
00433             break;
00434 
00435           if (L_is_int_constant (opB->src[0]))
00436             {
00437               if (!SIMM_9 (opB->src[0]->value.i))
00438                 break;
00439             }
00440           else if (!L_is_variable (opB->src[0]) ||
00441                    !L_no_defs_between (opB->src[0], opA, opB) ||
00442                    (st && L_store_opcode (opA)))
00443             {
00444               break;
00445             }
00446 
00447           if (!L_no_danger ((L_is_macro (address) ||
00448                              L_is_macro (opB->src[0])), 0, 0, opA, opB))
00449             break;
00450 
00451           if (conservative)
00452             {
00453               if (!L_no_other_def_use_in_cb (cb, address, opA, opB, NULL))
00454                 break;
00455 
00456               if (L_live_out_inhibits_scheduling (cb, address, opB))
00457                 break;
00458             }
00459 
00460           /* pattern matched. */
00461 #ifdef DEBUG_POST_INC
00462           fprintf (stderr, "mem %d, add %d -> Post increment\n",
00463                    opA->id, opB->id);
00464 #endif
00465           Convert_mem_op_to_post_inc (opA, L_copy_operand (opB->src[0]));
00466           L_delete_oper (cb, opB);
00467           break;
00468         }
00469     }
00470   return;
00471 }
Generated on Sat Aug 30 18:02:29 2014 for libiamopti by  1.4.7
